ISSUE.TITLE: Enum difference v4/v5 - "Choose here" as null value
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ## Bug report ### Required System information - Node.js version: 20 - Yarn version: 4.3.1 - Strapi version: 5.0.6 - 5.1.1 - Database: N/A - Operating system: Mac - Is your project Javascript or Typescript: N/A ### Describe the bug In Strapi v4 a user could create an enum - a content editor could select values but could also select "Choose here" as a an empty string value. ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7646f8ec-b9b7-43c2-a2ea-97fb5caeaca1) In Strapi v5 a user can create an enum - a content editor cannot select anything other than a value, is this expected? Should users have to create an enum with their own empty string value option? ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9059722e-ef74-422b-8d3c-1df056996c72) ### Steps to reproduce the behaviour 1. Create an enum on Strapi v4 - check content editor experience (choose here option exists) 2. Create an enum on Strapi v5 - check content editor experience (no choose here option) ### Expected behaviour If we're basing expected behaviour on what v4 had, we should have a 'Choose here' option. If it's expected in v5 that a empty string value option needs to be added by the user we should update the documentation to reflect this. https://docs.strapi.io/user-docs/content-type-builder/configuring-fields-content-type#-enumeration Edit: Changed null to empty string

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: fix(e2e): update data import and export scripts (#22071)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix(issue 22026 : Enum difference v4/v5 - "Choose here" as null value): added Enum Choose here- null Ref : #22026
